alert.note: Alert for Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 3:19PM CDT until April 23 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PRAIRIE...CENTRAL MONROE AND NORTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS COUNTIES... At 319 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Clarendon, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Clarendon... Holly Grove... Ulm... Roe... Alfrey... Dobbs Landing... Palmer... Peppers Landing... Blackton... Aberdeen... Monroe... Casscoe... Pine City... Keevil... Lawrenceville... Duncan... Almyra Airport... Ragtown... Louisiana Purchase State Park... TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern and southeastern Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
